title: CITRIS Foundry: Building A Successful Bio Startup 4/25/2018
description:
On April 25th, CITRIS hosted Y Combinator President Sam Altman to discuss how to build a successful bio startup. Joining him on the panel were successful life science entrepreneurs including UC Berkeley faculty and alumni.

Panelists (left to right):
Sam Altman, President at Y Combinator
Dr. Kelly Gardner, Co-Founder & CEO at Zephyrus Biosciences
Prof. Dave Schaffer, Co-Founder at 4D Molecular Therapeutics
Dr. Akwasi Apori, Co-Founder at Correlia Biosystems
Alex Mok, Co-Founder & CEO at Mantra Bio

About Y Combinator (http://ycombinator.com):
Apply to YCâ€™s Bio program at YCombinator.com/apply and send any questions to ycbio@ycombinator.com

About CITRIS (http://citris-uc.org):
CITRIS and the Banatao Institute was created by the California state legislature to shorten the pipeline between world-class laboratory research and the development of applications, platforms, companies, and even new industries. It leverages the research strengths of University of California campuses at Berkeley, Davis, Merced and Santa Cruz, and the entrepreneurial spirit of Silicon Valley.
